Metadata: Response of the interrenal to adrenocorticotr​opic hormone after short-term thyroxine treatment of coho salmon ("Oncorhynchus kisutch")

Thyroid hormones are involved in the regulation of the adrenal cortex in various mammals and in chickens, and there is some evidence for a regulatory role of thyroid hormones on the anuran (frog) interrenal during metamorphosis. This study reports the effects of short-term thyroxine treatment of coho salmon at two different stages of development on the subsequent response of the interrenal to ACTH (adrenocorticot​ropic hormone) in-vitro.
